hypothesis_content.title: Positive Catalyst Fade in Bear/Stress Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In BEAR or STRESS regimes, a positive price spike (>2% in 30min) driven by a bullish catalyst (e.g., ETF inflow announcement, positive regulatory news) will be aggressively sold into, with price returning to or below pre-spike levels within 2-3 hours, as the dominant regime narrative overpowers the transient catalyst.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In entrenched downtrends or risk-off environments, market participants use rallies as exit opportunities. Weak-handed longs from the spike quickly take profits, while new shorts are initiated. The catalyst is viewed as insufficient to change the macro regime, leading to a rapid fade.
entry_conditions: Catalyst is identified as positive but non-structural (e.g., daily ETF inflow, minor regulatory clarity)
Spike occurs on lower-than-average spot volume (vs 20-day median)
Price remains below key moving average (e.g., 20-period EMA on 4H chart)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 100% of the initial 30-minute spike (back to pre-spike level)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains above the spike high for 2 consecutive 1-hour closes

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 3-hour return after entry is positive, or price fails to retrace >70% of the initial spike in >60% of cases.
